intro: Pratia angulata var. minor, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pratia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions. It is a low-growing herb that thrives in well-drained environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in its natural habitat.
